title: What are your favorite Korean hip hop songs? - Quora

response.answer_text: ‘IGOHOLIC’ - PLT This song is my favorite khiphop song ever. It’s so catchy and it sounds so freaking cool. The vocals are also present and let me just say, it’s phenomenal. ‘All I Wanna Do’ - Jay Park, Hoody, and Loco This was one of the first Jay Park songs I heard and I actually first fell in love with the choreography. I loved the production and the sound is awesome. ‘Cupid’ - pH-1 and PENOMECO It has such 00′ vibes to it and that’s what I love about this song. The flow was perfect throughout the song and the chorus is beyond catchy. ‘Post It’ - Loco and Jay Park I actually first heard the Hwasa and Loco version (stan talent, stan mamamoo) but I really like the original version too. It’s really laid back but the vocal delivery Loco gives out is gorgeous. I love every part of this song. ‘Gottasadae’ - BewhY All of the different sounds in the song shook me. Byungyoon is a super fast rapper and that part in the song shook me too. His flow is beyond amazing and the transitions are super good. ‘Mommae’ - Jay Park and Ugly Duck It actually took me a while to like this song but now it’s one of my favorites. This song just makes me go “ayeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeee”, it’s that good! ‘Full House’ - MOBB The vibe in this song is so awesome and I really enjoy the chorus. Mino’s verses were actually my favorite but they both killed it. ‘Transcend’ - BewhY and C Jamm The intro is a huge tease but they didn’t let me down. The guitar in the beginning hooked me immediately but C JAMM can sing. He can seriously sing. I love the sound and the vibe this song gives off, it’s fantastic. ‘HOLUP!’ - Bobby This is such a dope song. It’s actually super chaotic but he makes it work. It takes a few listens to enjoy but it’s really, really good. His rapping voice is also super unique which makes it even better. ‘Puzzle’ - BewhY and C Jamm I loved this song from the first listen. It’s seriously aMAZING. The hype is wonderful and he’s so good at rap-singing (whatever you call it). ‘OKEY DOKEY’ - Mino and Zico (Haha, I forgot I was writing this answer and watched the video twice) I love how fun and hype this song is. It’s just a really dope song that has wonderful stage presence and you can tell they had fun performing it. ‘Pour Up’ - Dean and Zico This is one of my favorites by Dean (happy birthday bb <33), it’s so good and the vocals are wonderful. Zico helped add so much flair to this song but they are such a great mix. This song is nice and the amount of talent is beyond me. ‘I’m Not Sorry’ - Dean and Eric Bellinger I don’t know if this song counts but I do know that this song is fucking amazing. The vocals in this song?! Amazing. The production is great and their voices mix really well together. I love the lyrics too. ‘Me Like Yuh’ - Jay Park and Hoody I love his vocals. It’s surprisingly a really peaceful song and it’s a super gorgeous listen. Hoody Kim has such a gorgeous voice and I love how she contributed to the song. The choreography is also really good too. Omg, this actually got long, haha ~fm

The k-hip hop songs I listened to the most this week are: Show Me Luv - Changmo  8:45 Heaven- Drunken Tiger  I’ll be there - CHEETAH  Timeless - Drunken Tiger ft. RM  Love Drunk - Epik high ft. CRUSH  NOAH- HAON ft. Jay Park & HOODY  MOMMAE - Jay Park (LOWKEY A GUILTY PLEASURE SONG)  Marathon- Dok2  Monster - Drunken Tiger  Thanks for reading, Izzy Brewer
